New Records: Colombia extended their unbeaten streak to 27 matches
Key Match Events: Colombia dominated the match with a 5-0 win over Panama
James Rodríguez scored 2 goals, including a powerful penalty kick
Luis Díaz scored 2 goals, including a lobbed shot over the Panama goalkeeper
Richard Ríos blasted a long right-footed shot past the Panama goalkeeper
Miguel Borja converted a penalty kick in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Colombia came into the match on a 26-match unbeaten streak
Panama had an unexpected run to the quarterfinals, including a 2-1 win over the United States
Post-Match Reflections: Colombia coach Néstor Lorenzo praised James Rodríguez's performance
Panama manager Thomas Christiansen said the team had to learn from their mistakes and improve their quality, speed, and intensity
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of an announced crowd of 39,740 at State Farm Stadium
The retractable roof of the stadium was closed due to high temperatures
Colombia will play in the semifinals on Wednesday against Uruguay
